column4: hey, sudo emacs & asks for the password which is not masked. How do I mask it?
the TERM variable must be wrong
you can  do visudo  and change it to not require the password for that program, which is a quick way to hack around it
of course you can just su to become root
no I don't want a hack
then you'll have to figure out how your configuration got totally borked
because passwords are, of course, not echoed
so it's been borked from the beginning.  not really relevant.  I have 12 ubuntu systems here at the moment, and none of them echo passwords
when you open a program in the background?
what's happening is that it believes that it has disabled echo.  that's why I said that the terminal configuration must be incorrect.
